headline: Balsamic Chicken
description: This balsamic chicken recipe uses a sweet, tangy balsamic vinegar marinade that doubles as sauce to give pan-fried chicken breasts flavor and color.
name: Balsamic Chicken

recipeInstructions.text: Whisk together chicken broth, balsamic vinegar, sugar, Italian seasoning, and garlic in a bowl. Place chicken breasts in marinade; let marinate for 10 minutes on each side.

Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Remove chicken from marinade; reserve marinade. Place chicken in the hot skillet and cook until browned and no longer pink inside, about 7 minutes per side.

Pour marinade into the skillet. Cook until sauce thickens slightly, turning chicken breasts over once or twice, about 5 minutes. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center of a chicken breast should read at least 165 degrees F (74 degrees C).

review.reviewBody: Not terrible but not great. The sauce tasted lovely when I first made it but it didn't seep into the chicken very much so the chicken was very bland. Also, the sauce didn't thicken up for me. I may need to add some flour into it next time. I made it with brown rice and roasted veggies.
This was SO DELICIOUS. Super easy and such a great flavor, a real keeper.
Easy and delicious. Would go with rice, potatoes, and most vegetables.
I wasn’t sure if everyone would like the balsamic flavour so i added about half a cup of apple juice to it. Very nice! Would make again
Served over rice delish.
Obsessed! delicious!

I added 1 tbsp honey to recipe, & bc I read comments saying it was acidic, I marinaded for only 5 minutes. To save time I cut the chicken into strips, cooked it w/salt, pepper, paprika. While the chicken cooked i reduced the balsamic mixture, then added it to the pan when the chicken was half cooked. It was delicious!!

I cut up the chicken in small pieces and used this recipe as a base for a chicken stir-fry over rice noodles. It was amazing....yummy and soft chicken pieces beside celery, garlic, onion, and sweet pepper pieces. All smothered in a sweet& sour sauce which I thickened with corn starch. I highly recommend it.

Not horrible but could use more flavor. I made the marinade into a glaze/gravy since it doesn't thicken up even on a boil. Let the chicken sit for 25/30 minutes only put 1 tbs sugar & 2/3 cup balsamic vinegar. Used oil and a bit of butter to cook the chicken medium rare/medium then cut into strips and set aside. Put marinade in and it would not thicken so I added flour so it did eventually thicken then added chicken in when it was almost thick enough to my liking. Reminds me of sweet n sour chicken but in a balsamic way. Good over yellow rice.
I added a touch of honey and my ever finicky kids ate it all!
Quick and easy. Tastes great too.
This was great. I didn’t have Italian Herb seasoning so I used basil, oregano, and parsley. Delicious.
This was sooooo easy and seriously delicious!
It was “ok”. Something different to do with chicken but not a keeper for us.
Easy to make but not that great. I will not save this recipe.
Was sweeter than i prefer.
It sooo delicious!! Will make again!!

This was outstanding!! As suggested I cut the chicken in pieces. It was fork tender and rated an A+ by husband. Served with asparagus and scalloped potatoes. Next time I might make mashed potatoes for some of that gravy! Just delicious. Thank you Sherrylynn2!!
I've had better balsamic chicken recipes. This is very blasé. Needs some salt and garlic
Was looking for something easy and tasty to add to our menu planning, and this nailed it! The family loved it!

The chicken broth made it hard to cook the chicken because it absorbed the water and it turned out rubbery. I normally like to make this with green beans and sun-dried tomatoes, but the way the chicken is marinated and cooked in this recipe doesn't work well with vegetables. The flavor of it was good, but the texture of the chicken was rubbery. I can barely eat it. Such a waste.

This was easy to make and absolutely delicious! I used caramelized onion avocado oil, bourbon balsamic vinegar, and salt-free Sunny Herb Blend instead of the Italian seasoning (all three from Red Stick Spice Company in Baton Rouge) and the results were fabulous!
Very sweet. I doubled the recipe to use with vegetables too. The chicken was okay the veggies were almost inedible. Will not be making this again

It was pretty good. Very simple recipe which I appreciated. However the recipe felt like it was missing something, maybe some salt and pepper to offset the sweetness when reducing the marinade. Gonna try it again and see how it goes. Thanks!
I followed the recipe and it turned out way to dry and we were not a fan of the marinade/sauce at all. Definitely will not be making this again!
Quick, easy and delicious!

Great recipe! The marinade is enough for 2 more chicken breasts. The sauce takes a while to thicken, so it's best to remove the chicken breasts from the pan and cook the marinade on high heat for about 10 minutes. Once the marinade cooks down, add the chicken breasts back to the pan for a couple minutes.
Very good, easy meal, but I would make more marinade and maybe add something like mushrooms or onions while cooking. Great over rice or pasta, or even over a salad with balsamic dressing.
My husband and I love this recipe! I have made it two weeks in a row since I found it. Thanks for sharing
love it
Absolutely delicious! Made this twice with chicken breasts I needed to cook ASAP. Ended up eating both breasts myself, both times... Definitely adding to my stack of favorite recipes.
I used balsamic vinegrette because it was all I had. This was AMAZING!!!!!!
Easy and delicious!

Really liked the flavor! Couldn't get the marinade to thicken on its own and would probably try to tweak it a little next time I make it (add some diced tomatoes, angel hair pasta, parmesan cheese, etc.) to make it a little more interesting, but good basic recipe!

I will have to try it again with modifications such as reducing the amount of sugar or changing the balsamic vinegar and broth ratio. All it tasted like to us was sugared chicken with a hint of balsamic vinegar.
It was good, but it certainly takes longer to cook the chicken. Will try it again.

I made this with chicken tenders that I briefly pan-fried. The balsamic flavor comes through nicely. I had a few with some dipping sauce (Honey Mustard Sauce) from this site. The rest I plan to cut up and top a salad with. Much better than the cooked, store-bought marinated chicken that always seems dried out. Thanks - great recipe!
So easy and delicious! Everyone loved it, even a picky eater! My granddaughter called me next day for the recipe!
Excellent!
I think I will leave out the sugar and add more spices next time.
So good. The only chance I made was using honey vs sugar.

My husband thought it was good. I personally thought it was too sweet. And I used good balsamic. It certainly was easy so I might try it again reducing (or eliminating?) the sugar. Considering the rave reviews, I was disappointed.

Really good! Followed the recipe exactly, using a quality balsamic vinegar that I could drink straight from the bottle. The only additional step I did was to remove the chicken from the pan and add a tablespoon of cornstarch. We were starving and it seemed to be taking a while to reduce and thicken. Served with brown rice and steamed veggies. Everyone loved it.
A very tasty quick and easy recipe. It was enjoyed by the whole family.
It was not good...something about it was overpowering with the vinegar. Maybe it needed some Parmesan to taper it? We did not like this...sorry!
Made it just as the recipe stated...used Red Apple Balsamic from my local specialty shop which gave it a tart sweet taste. Super flavorful!
Using chicken tenderloins instead of whole breasts
If you're a big balsamic fan, I'd say you'll really like this. Flavorful and has a classic feel and taste to it.
I omitted some of the more spicier components and it still is very good. I found a balsamic vinegar that has honey with it it was good
I’ve followed the advice of others, but I find I don’t need to double the marinade, just split it in half. It’s really good and I make it often. Super healthy too!

Was an excellent recipe served with basmati rice. I added a small amount of water and corn starch mix to thicken the sauce at the end. The next time I make this recipe I will add in some thick slices of sweet Vidalia onion and maybe some mushrooms to give it a kick.
This turned out perfect using chicken breast tenders! It was moist and delicious.
Made exactly as written and loved it.
I added about twice the sugar and it was AMAZING!! Sweet but still had a nice acidity to it from the vinegar.

Really, Really Good!!! I know, bc my honey didn’t scrape the sauce off and get out the ketchup!!?? Two big thumbs up for my first taste of anything balsamic vinegar! I followed the recipe except used minced garlic instead of fresh. We all voted to add this to the dinner rotation!
So simple and yet so good.
I omitted the sugar for dietary reasons, however, the recipe was fantastic. Quick an easy.

This was delicious. I made the recipe as is. The only change I made was to marinate the breasts for 3-4 hours before cooking them. The only complaint was that, for some reason, some of the chicken pieces got "tough," even though I didn't overcook them on the stovetop. Not sure what happened there. The flavor was wonderful and I served them with the same marinade (which I made sure to boil).
My husband is meh over chicken but he said definitely make this one again! The recipe has normal household ingredients and was super fast.
It was terrible. No flavor after marinated for hours
I agree it is tasty but it was too sweet for us. Will try it again with less sugar. We had it with white rice but will try rice pilaf... the saltiness might compliment the sweetness.
I added chopped green onion and sliced mushrooms while Browning chicken. Easy dish , tasted great
I used half the measurements because I had less chicken to work with and it was fantastic. I had a little remaining in marinade and used it in the skillet and cooked noodles in it.

I made this on this past Saturday. It is now Tuesday, and my husband is begging for it again. He LOVES it! I served it over Rotini pasta that had a little butter, onion powder, and garlic powder on it only. That's how we will have it tonight also, however, we were trying to decide between pasta and rice. I ended up marinating the chicken for a few hrs doing other things and had made thin strips, not breasts. I used med high heat as suggested, but I think this stove cooks hot. I just went with it. I seared he chicken on both sides and let it cook a few minutes on both sides. Because they were thin, it worked out brilliantly. The chicken had a wonderful caramelized seared outside due to the sugar and inside was very moist. The chicken was so flavorful! I highly recommend this dish, but marinate as long as you can. also, I did not make a sauce out f the remaining marinade. I thought it would be overkill. Just the chicken pulled from the marinade, placed in a hot pan, and put on the pasta.
I used chicken tenders, bite sized diced with garlic, onions, one diced ancho pepper and some sun dried tomatoes and quartered mushrooms. A wonderful one skillet meal.
My wife and I liked it. Only thing I did different was add corn starch and water to thicken the marinade. Next time, as some suggested, add some mushrooms and peppers.

There was nothing wrong with this recipe that I can point out. It tasted okay for me, simple to make with everything I usually have in the pantry. My Husband didn't go nuts over it but he had no complaints. 

I did make enough for leftovers. Although I didn't serve them as a main dinner protein again, they made an EXCELLENT add to my individual meal planning. I.E., salads, brown rice and veggies, egg white scrambles, etc.

I portion and measure most meals for myself as part of my weekly health/fitness routine and it gets difficult to prepare chicken breasts in ways that are creative.

There's a good probability that I did something wrong when following the recipe. I'll try it again.
My husband is such a picky eater, but gave two thumbs up! Great taste...
I added a mixture of Panko bread crumbs and butter. Put in on top and browned it. Then poured the sauce over it. Delicious!
This was tasty and quick to make. I added onions, mushrooms, and red peppers when sautéing the chicken. The sauce was just right – not too sweet, not too vinegary.

This recipe was excellent! The only change I made was that I added 1/2 cup of red and yellow bell peppers to the marinade. The sauce wasn’t overly acidic at all, but I also used a high quality balsamic vinegar. I served the chicken over zucchini noodles. It was a big hit!
Hit with the family. I used Balsamic Vinaigrette dressing instead of balsamic vinegar, it was all I had. But it was good.
I have made this chicken more than once. It turns out a little sweet if anything because of the sugar. However the sauce thickness has been inconsistent for me. My family really likes the chicken.

Since. Moving to a low sodium diet recently, I have been looking for things to cook. This was one of the first things I I tried. Turned out great. Even my son loved it .. No changes needed as far as I was concerned other than I would let it marinade for longer than 20 mins. Also it's helpful that all recipes gives a general nutrition label and a host of low sodium recipes
Turned out really good and that too in a very short time....
Pretty good! A little sweet but was complimented well by the salt and vinegar potato’s I made.
Best balsamic chicken recipe ever! Reduced the sugar by half and still delicious, so flavorful!

We loved this! And as other have mentioned, if the dish tastes vinegary, then next time use a high quality balsamic! My dish turned out perfectly, great balanced flavors and made exactly as in the recipe. This is certainly going in rotation for us! Thank you SherryLynn!
I make this for a sandwich, I put it on either a ciabatta or sourdough bread with goat cheese and avocado. This is one of my favorite sandwiches.

Delicious! Made this chicken with sides of garlic mash and broccoli. But instead of 2 tbs sugar, I did 1 tbs sugar & 2 tbs lemon juice. Also made 2 servings of the marinade - 1 to marinate the chicken, and another to reduce and use as sauce.
Very simple to make and delicious! I will make this agsin.
So yummy. I served it over rotini with green beans.
Very good. I followed the directions exactly and it was moist and tasty. Served with rice pilaf and (in season) green beans.

Made this tonight and it was delicious! I didn't change a thing and there wasn't a scrap left. Even my, "I don't like chicken" teen ate every bit and was sopping up the leftover sauce with focaccia. I did pull the chicken out at the end and reduce for another three minutes but that was just to sweeten the balsamic sauce a bit more.
Absolutely delicious! My husband gobbled it down and kept saying Mmmmmmmm.
Made per recipe. I've had better. I like the Braised Balsamic Chicken recipe more.
I made it but the only difference I made was replacing the sugar with truvia to make it diabetic-friendly.

This chicken does not need all the added sugar, only a little brown sugar. Can also be all put together inside a aluminum foil packet and cooked in an oven or electric toaster oven. I made it and added some caramelized onions to throw on top Divine. Cook the remaining marinade on the side with the caramelized onions. 
The chicken will be cooking inside the foil packets nice and moist.
Easy, tasty. Made it because it is lower sodium. Smelled so good.

I had a whole chicken, so I used the marinade on the split chicken, pan seared it on both sides 5 minutes each. Then I baked the chicken in the oven at 350 degrees F for 30 minutes. I reduced the balsamic marinade (boiled it down until concentrated and a bit thickened) , baste it on the chicken and baked it another 10 minutes or until juices run clear from the leg joints. Cut up tye chicken into pieces, sprinkled some salt (tasted a little weak without it) and served this with fresh raspberries. My teens really enjoyed this!

As it is it's an okay recipe. It is very sweet. Which if you like that then that's great. It's a little too sweet for me and my family. It is very easy to make though! I will make this again but I will probably cut out some of the sugar!
I followed the recipe exactly and I even marinated the chicken all day but the flavor just wasn't there. It was just a little bland. I'm going to try it again, maybe take out the chicken broth?

I made it and it was just okay. I did use extra garlic in the marinade, I love garlic. I also used a pinch of salt and my husband actually added more after because he thought it was a little bland. I too thought it was bland, but I will try it again and marinate the chicken breast longer.
Great tasting recipe.
Made this for the second time, very easy to prepare and utterly delicious! The only thing I substituted was garlic powder for fresh garlic.

I've made this three times now. Husband loves it. I doubled the marinade so we would have extra and poured over buttered rigatoni, delicious. Definitely a go-to recipe when I need to make something for dinner.
my husband loved this exactly as written. he said it tasted gourmet. thanks, sherrylynn, for sharing this awesome recipe!
Even my kids loved it!
No changes, easy, fast... Delicious !!!
